Annotation.String: Collection of resources that are managed and exposed to hosts as a group.

Collection of resources that the system can make available to one or more host systems. The collection can contain: block, file, or object storage; local system access points through which the collection is made available; hosts, or host access points to which the collection is made available.
StorageGroup resources can be updated to change the writable properties.
StorageGroup resources can be deleted by deleting the StorageGroup resource.
The Expose and Hide Volume actions are redundant with REST PATCH/PUT operations.
Expose the storage volumes of this group.

Exposes the storage of this group via the target endpoints named in the ServerEndpointGroups to the initiator endpoints named in the ClientEndpointGroups. The property VolumesAreExposed shall be set to true when this action is completed.
The Expose and Hide Volume actions are redundant with REST PATCH/PUT operations.
Hide the storage volumes of this group.
Hide the storage of this group from the initiator endpoints named in the ClientEndpointGroups. The property VolumesAreExposed shall be set to false when this action is completed.
Relate a SCSI Logical Unit Number to a Volume.
Relate a SCSI Logical Unit Number to a Volume.
A SCSI Logical Unit Number for a Volume.
If present, the value is a SCSI Logical Unit Number for the Volume.
A mapped Volume.
The value shall reference a mapped Volume.
Supported IO access capability.
Each entry shall specify the storage access capability for this mapped volume.
Endpoints are allowed to perform reads from the specified resource.
Endpoints are allowed to perform reads from and writes to the specified resource.
Collection of resources that are managed and exposed to hosts as a group.
A storage group collects a set of related storage entities (volumes, file systems...) The collection should be useful for managing the storage of a set of related client applications.
The value identifies this resource.
The value shall be unique within the managed ecosystem.
AccessState for this storage group.
The value of this property shall describe the access characteristics of this storage group. All associated logical units through all aggregated ports shall share this access state.
Deprecated in favor of using the ConsistencyGroup for Consistency set management.
Members are kept in a consistent state.
The value of this property shall be set to true if all members are in a consistent state. The default value for this property is false.
Storage volumes are exposed to paths defined by the client and server endpoints.
The value of this property shall be set to true if storage volumes are exposed to the paths defined by the client and server endpoints. The default value for this property is false.
The property contains the status of the StorageGroup.
The property shall contain the status of the StorageGroup.
Contains links to other resources that are related to this resource.
This property shall contain links to other resources that are related to this resource.
Deprecated in favor of using the ConsistencyGroup for Consistency set management.
Describes this storage group in its role as a target for replication.
This property shall describe the replication relationship between this storage group and a corresponding source storage group.
Groups of client endpoints in this storage group.

An array of references to groups of client-side endpoints that may be used to make requests to the storage exposed by this StorageGroup. If null, the implementation may allow access to the storage via any client-side endpoint. If empty, the implementation shall not allow access to the storage via any client-side endpoint.
Groups of server endpoints in this storage group.

An array of references to groups of server-side endpoints that may be used to make requests to the storage exposed by this storage group. If null, the implementation may allow access to the storage via any server-side endpoint. If empty, the implementation shall not allow access to the storage via any server-side endpoint.
These references are replaced by the MappedVolumes array in StorageGroup.
Volumes in this storage group.
An array of references to volumes managed by this storage group.
The available actions for this resource.
The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
Contains links to other resources that are related to this resource.
This structure shall contain references to resources that are not contained within this resource.
Parent StorageGroups.
An array of references to StorageGroups that incorporate this StorageGroup.
Child StorageGroups.
An array of references to StorageGroups are incorporated into this StorageGroup.
The ClassOfService that all storage in this StorageGroup conforms to.
The ClassOfService that all storage in this StorageGroup conforms to.
The available actions for this resource.
This property shall contain any actions for this resource.
This property contains the available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This property shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
The Expose and Hide Volume actions are redundant with REST PATCH/PUT operations. Also, the extra level of a EndpointGroupCollection is not needed. Change references to unversioned.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to fix CSDL errors and adds both Redfish Uris and Capability Annotations.
WIP v1.0.7
This update replaces Volumes with MappedVolumes to support logical unit numbers. It also replaces collection StorageReplicaInfos with scalar StorageReplicaInfo.
Mapped Volumes in this storage group.
An array of mapped volumes managed by this storage group.
This version adds ReplicaTargets collection.
Deprecated in favor of using the ConsistencyGroup for Consistency set management.
The resources that are target replicas of this source.
The value shall reference the target replicas that are sourced by this replica.
This version was created to fix CSDL errors and adds both Redfish Uris and Capability Annotations.
TP v1.0.7a
This version adds CHAP information.
The Authentication method used for the Endpoints involved in this StorageGroup.
The value of this property must be what kind of authentication that the endpoints in this StorageGroup understands.
The credential information used to authenticate the endpoints in this StorageGroup.

The value of this property must reflect the authentication used by this specific endpoint. If this endpoint represents an initiator, and AuthenticationMethod is CHAP or MutualCHAP, the Credentials fields CHAPUsername and CHAPSecret must be used. If this endpoint represents a target endpoint and AuthenticationMethod is MutualCHAP, then MutualCHAPUsername and MutualCHAPSecret must be used.
No authentication is used.
iSCSI Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) authentication is used.
iSCSI Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) authentication is used. For ChapInfo, the CHAPUser and CHAPPassword properties shall be used when type CHAP is selected.
iSCSI Mutual Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) authentication is used.

iSCSI Mutual Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) authentication is used. For ChapInfo, the InitiatorCHAPUser, InitiatorCHAPPassword, TargetCHAPUser, and TargetCHAPPassword properties shall be used when type MutualCHAP is selected.
Diffie-Hellman Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (DHCHAP) is an authentication protocol used in Fibre Channel.

Diffie-Hellman Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (DHCHAP) is an authentication protocol used in Fibre Channel. When MutualCHAP is selected, DHChapInfo shall be used instead of CHAPInfo, and the LocalDHCHAPAuthSecret and PeerDHCHAPAuthSecret properties shall be used.
User name and password for CHAP authentication.
User name and password values for target and initiators Endpoints when CHAP authentication is used.
The Initiator username for Mutual (2-way) CHAP authentication by the initiator.
If present, this property is the initiator CHAP username for Mutual (2-way) authentication. For example, with an iSCSI scenario, use the initiator iQN.
The shared secret for Mutual (2-way) CHAP authentication by the initiator.
The value of this property shall be the shared secret for Mutual (2-way)CHAP authentication.
The Target CHAP Username for Mutual (2-way) CHAP authentication by the target.
The value of this property shall be the Target CHAP Username for Mutual (2-way) CHAP authentication. For example, with an iSCSI scenario, use the target iQN.
This property is deprecated in favor of TargetCHAPPassword.
The value of this property shall be the CHAP Secret for 2-way CHAP authentication.

PropertyValue.String: This property is deprecated in favor of TargetCHAPPassword.

Annotation.String: This version was created to fix CSDL errors, and marking consistency-related properties as Deprecated.
This version was created to update CHAP and CHAPInformation descriptions.
The User name and password for Mutual 2-way CHAP authentication.
The User name and password values for target and initiators Endpoints when Mutual CHAP authentication is used.
WIP v1.2.0
This version was created to add simple username and passwords to CHAPInformation.
The credential information used to authenticate the endpoints in this StorageGroup for DHCHAP.

The value of this property must reflect the authentication used by this specific endpoint when the authentication type is specificed as DHCHAP. If this endpoint represents an initiator, and AuthenticationMethod is DHCHAP, the Credentials fields LocalDHCHAPAuthSecret and PeerDHCHAPAuthSecret must be used.
Adds simple user name and password for CHAP authentication.
Adds user name and password values for use when CHAP authentication is used.
The username for CHAP authentication.
The value of this property shall be the username when CHAP authentication is specified.
The password for CHAP authentication.
The value of this property shall be the password when CHAP authentication is specified.
The Target CHAP Secret for Mutual (2-way) CHAP authentication by the target.
The value of this property shall be the CHAP Secret for 2-way CHAP authentication.
User name and password for CHAP authentication.
User name and password values for target and initiator endpoints when CHAP authentication is used.
The local DHCHAP auth secret for DHCHAP authentication.
This property shall be the local DHCHAP auth secret for DHCHAP authentication.
The peer DHCHAP auth secret for DHCHAP authentication.
The value of this property shall be the peer DHCHAP auth secret for DHCHAP authentication.
This version was created to add access capabilities to mapped volumes.
TP v1.2.1c
This version was created to change the reference for EndpointGroup_v1 to the Redfish version.
